etymology.description: Depicts the head of a nail -> evolved into derivatives representing 'nail' 釘(釘), 'head' 天(天) and 頂(頂), 'city wall' 成(成) and 城(城)
etymology.interpretation: The character 丁(丁) (dīng) originally depicted the head of a nail. It was used as a base form in the creation of several other characters that evolved to represent different meanings such as 'nail', 'head', and 'city wall'.

examples.chinese: 丁是一个汉字(丁是一個漢字)。
‘丁’的读音为 dīng(‘丁’的讀音為 dīng)。
